topic.title: ITS_PKT500 Datapath Runtime API

body.p: The following API configure the various generator and monitor options for the IPTS block. See the table below for the API details and configuration sequence.

entry.p: Initializes the generator of ITS PKT500 block and sets its location in the Interlaken channel datapath.
Configures the channel mapping for a specific generator channel and provides the default behavior of IPTS tag frame and packet configuration.
Removes the channel mapping for a specific channel and reverts the packet configuration to the default value.
Selects one of the four headers to fill the header data into. The four headers are as follows: a single 128 byte header (header 0) or one of three 32 byte headers (headers 1 to 3).
Configures the minimum and maximum packet length for the random packet length generators.
Configures the ITS_PKT500 tag frame for a specific channel.
Configures the ITS_PKT500 packet for a specific channel.
Controls the generation of IPTS packets, and also controls the traffic data rate when continuous run traffic is turned on.
Initializes the monitor block of ITS PKT500 and inserts the monitor into the Interlaken channel datapath.
Configures the channel mapping for a specific monitor channel and provides the default configuration of IPTS monitor block.
Removes the configuration of the channel mapping for a specific monitor channel and reverts the monitor block configuration to the default value.
Configures the ITS_PKT500 monitor block for a specific channel.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_gen_location_cfg()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_gen_location_cfg() API initializes the generator of ITS PKT500 block and sets its location in the Interlaken channel datapath. This sets the generation insertion location in the fabric ingress (towards the DCPB) or fabric egress paths (towards Interlaken). This configuration applies to all generator channels. Note: This API can be called anytime to change the generation insertion location. The change of generation insertion location can be happen on active channel, it will not affect existing traffic on that channel. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance.

The gen_location parameter of the g5_api_ipts_gen_location_cfg() API defines the generation insertion location and is defined by the the enumeration g5_ipts_location_t. The gen_location choices are shown in Table 2 below.

entry.p: This is the default value.Generator or Monitor disabled.
Monitor receives data from DCPB interface. Generates data towards the Interlaken interface,
Generates data from the Interlaken interface towards the DCPB interface, Monitors data from the Interlaken backplane into the device.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_cfg()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_cfg() API configures the channel mapping for a specific generator channel and provides the default behavior of IPTS tag frame and packet configuration. The user needs to call the g5_api_ipts_gen_location_cfg() API before calling this to ensure that the generator is configured properly. This API provisions an IPTS channel if the user defined chnl_id is a Interlaken packet segment channel. Otherwise an error is returned. This API can be called again to configure another channel. However, system will return an error if the user tries to provision a previously provisioned channel. This function configures the IPTS channel only and does not start packet generation until required APIs are called.The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chld_id parameter is the user defined channel ID for the provisioned Interlaken instance.
Default Behavior:

li.p: IPTS Tag frame: no tag frame inserted including FCS
Packet Size (Random) : MIN: 1 Byte, MAX: 10,000 Byte

section.title: g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_uncfg()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_uncfg() API removes the channel mapping for a specific channel and reverts the packet configuration to the default value. This API de-provisions a previously provisioned IPTS channel if the user defined chnl_id is valid. Otherwise an error is returned. This API can be called again to deprov another channel. If the provided channel is not provisioned, no error is returned.The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chld_id parameter is the user defined channel ID for the provisioned Interlaken instance.
Default Behavior:

li.p: IPTS Tag frame: no tag frame inserted including FCS
Packet Size (Random) : MIN: 1 Byte, MAX: 10,000 Byte

section.title: g5_api_ipts_header_set()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_header_set() API selects one of the four fixed size global headers to fill the header data into. The four selectable fixed size headers are as follows: a single 128 byte header (header 0) or one of three 32 byte headers (headers 1 to 3). The IPTS header can be used to generate an Ethernet or a custom packet header. This function can be called more than once however, it will overwrite existing settings when called again. If the header is updated on active channels there could be inconsistent packet header data while the header data is being updated. However, during this transient period, the IPTS FCS will not be corrupted. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance.

The header_number parameter of the g5_api_ipts_header_set() API specifies which packet header to insert or if no header is to be inserted and is defined by the the enumeration g5_api_ipts_header_t. The header_number choices are shown in Table 3 below. G5_IPTS_BYTE_HEADER_NONE and G5_IPTS_BYTE_RANDOM are not use for g5_api_ipts_header_set().

entry.p: Entire packet payload is randomly filled.

section.p: The header parameter is used to fill in fixed size header data of the IPTS packet. For example: An Ethernet header can be injected in the IPTS packet using this header. The Source address of the Ethernet header can be injected at Byte 0-5, Destination address at Byte 6-11 and Ethertype at Byte 12-13 of the 128 Byte Header.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_packet_rand_set()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_packet_rand_set() API configures the minimum and maximum packet length for the random packet length generators. The user uses one of the two random number instances RANDOMIZER_INST_0 or RANDOMIZER_INST_1 to select one of the two random packet length generators and specifies the minimum and maximum packet size values in the range of 1-10000 Byte. The minimum packet length has to be 40 bytes to support a header and FCS. The maximum packet length is 10,000. A value greater than 10,000 will return an error. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance.

The rand_number parameter of the g5_api_ipts_packet_rand_set() API selects the random length packet generator 0 or 1. If rand_number = RANDOMIZER_INST_0 then random packet length generator 0 will be activated and if rand_number = RANDOMIZER_INST_1 then random packet length generator 1 will be activated.

The rand_len_max parameter is the maximum length of the packet length of the random packet generator. The maximum packet size is 10000. The rand_len_min parameter is the minimum length of the packet length of the random packet generator. The minimum the packet length can be is 40 bytes to support a header and FCS.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_tag_cfg()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_tag_cfg() API configures the ITS_PKT500 tag frame for a specific channel. This API allows the user to turn on/off individual IPTS tag in the IPTS packet. The user must call the g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_cfg() API prior to this API to ensure that IPTS channel is provisioned. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chld_id parameter is the user defined channel ID for the provisioned Interlaken instance.
The flow_id parameter of the g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_tag_cfg() API is the IPTS packet flow id value for each channel if value = G5_MAX_INT, flow id will not be inserted in IPTS packet.
The seq_id_enable parameter enables generation of sequence id in IPTS tag frame. The timestamp_enable parameter enables generation of time stamp in IPTS tag frame.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_packet_cfg()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_packet_cfg() API configures the ITS_PKT500 packet for a specific channel. The API activates one of the four IPTS headers, selects the IPTS tag frame offset from start of packet, and defines the length of the packet. The user must call the g5_api_ipts_header_set() and g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_tag_cfg() APIs prior to this API for proper operation. This API configures the ITS channel only and does not start packet generation until g5_api_ipts_gen_location_cfg() API is called. This API can be called again to reconfigure the packets. However, calling this API on a running channel will create some inconsistent packets for a transient period but the FCS will not be corrupted for those packets.

Note: In the IPTS packet, the 12 Byte IPTS tag frame has the higher priority and will overwrite the header bytes in the packet and a four byte FCS tag will be placed at the end of the packet. The packet length can range between 1-10,000 bytes. However, in order to generate a full IPTS tag frame and support a custom header without overwriting, the minimum packet length must be 40 bytes and the maximum 10,000 bytes. Any packet size above 10,000 bytes is illegal and will return an error. When using minimum packet length of 40 byte the IPTS tag frame at the start of packet be based on IPTS tag frame configuration.
The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chld_id parameter is the user defined channel ID for the provisioned Interlaken instance.

The header_number parameter of the g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_packet_cfg() specifies which packet header to insert or if no header is to be inserted and is defined by the g5_api_ipts_header_t enumeration shown in Table 3 above.
The fcs_gen_mode parameter of the g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_packet_cfg() defines the behavior of FCS in the generated packet and is defined by the g5_api_ipts_fcs_mode_t enumeration shown inTable 4 below.

entry.p: Generator: No IPTS FCS tag to be inserted in the packet.
Monitor: No FCS check in the incoming packet
Include all packet bytes as part of FCS calculation
Do not include first 32 bytes in FCS calculation.

section.p: The tag_location parameter of the g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_packet_cfg() determines the offset where the IPTS packet tag is inserted in the packet and is defined by the g5_api_ipts_tag_frame_offset_t enumeration shown in Table 5 below. The default is START.

row.entry: No IPTS tag frame to be inserted.

entry.p: Insert IPTS tag frame at the start of the packet.
Insert IPTS tag frame at 32 byte offset of start.
Insert IPTS tag frame at 64 byte offset of start.
Insert IPTS tag frame at 96 byte offset of start.

section.p: The length parameter of the g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_packet_cfg() is the length of the packet supporting values of 1-10000 for fixed length. The minimum packet length must be 40 bytes to support header insertion and FCS. To generate random length packets the g5_api_ipts_packet_rand_set() API needs to be called first where random packet length generator 0 or 1 is selected by defining the length parameter to RANDOMIZER_INST_0 or RANDOMIZER_INST_1.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_seq_id_reset()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_seq_id_reset() API resets the generator sequence id. To reset the sequence id users need to be set the seq_id_reset = TRUE, and call the g5_api_ipts_gen_cfg() API to start the traffic on that channel to reset sequence id. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chld_id parameter is the user defined channel ID for the provisioned Interlaken instance.

The seq_id_reset parameter of the g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_seq_id_reset() API defines whether to reset generator sequence id. When set to TRUE the sequence id is reset . When set to FALSE the sequence id is not reset.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_gen_cfg()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_gen_cfg() API controls the generation of IPTS packets, and also controls the traffic data rate when continuous run traffic is turned on. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chld_id parameter is the user defined channel ID for the provisioned Interlaken instance.

The command parameter of the g5_api_ipts_gen_cfg() API chooses to start continuous packet generation, to stop packet generation or to send a single packet as defined by the the enumeration g5_api_ipts_run_t shown in Table 6 below.

The traffic_rate parameter specifies the rate of traffic in percentage of the maximum line rate. The line rate is the Interlaken packet channel rate. The Fabric Egress channel's maximum rate is based upon the downstream application rate at the ENET, MAPOTN or Fabric Ingress channel. The Fabric Ingress channel's maximum rate is based upon the number of 1G25 increments assigned to the channel when the Fabric Ingress channel is provisioned.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_mon_cfg()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_mon_cfg() API initializes the monitor block of ITS PKT500 and inserts the monitor into the Interlaken channel datapath. Configures the monitor packet extraction location in fabric ingress from ILKN interface) and fabric egress(from the DCPB).This configuration applies to all monitor channels. Note This API can be called anytime to change monitor packet extraction location on the fly. There will be no affect on existing traffic for changing monitor detection location as the switching take place on the burst or packet boundaries. However, there will be packet sequence id error after changing the monitor detection location. It is recommended to reset the generator and monitor sequence id for clean error free startup. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance.

The mon_location parameter of the g5_api_ipts_gen_location_cfg() API defines the monitor location and is defined by the the enumeration g5_ipts_location_t. The mon_location choices are shown in Table 2 above.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_mon_chnl_cfg()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_mon_chnl_cfg() API configures the channel mapping for a specific monitor channel and provides the default configuration of IPTS monitor block. The default configuration is that the IPTS Tag frame does not check for the IPTS tag frame including the FCS. The user must call the g5_api_ipts_mon_cfg() API before calling this this API to ensure that the monitor direction is configured properly. This API can be called again to configure another monitor channel. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chld_id parameter is the user defined channel ID for the provisioned Interlaken instance.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_mon_chnl_uncfg()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_mon_chnl_uncfg() API removes the configuration of the channel mapping for a specific monitor channel and reverts the monitor block configuration to the default value. The default behavior is the IPTS Tag frame with no checking including FCS. This API de-provisions a previously provisioned IPTS monitor channel if the user defined chnl_id is valid. This API can be called again to de-provisions another channel. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chld_id parameter is the user defined channel ID for the provisioned Interlaken instance.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_mon_chnl_packet_cfg()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_mon_chnl_packet_cfg() API configures the ITS_PKT500 monitor block for a specific channel. This API allows the user to turn on/off monitoring of individual IPTS tag in the IPTS packet. The API also specifies IPTS tag frame location in the packet and defines the range of packets FCS calculation performed on. The user must call the g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_cfg API prior to this API to ensure that IPTS channel is provisioned. This API can be called again to reconfigure the monitor block. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chld_id parameter is the user defined channel ID for the provisioned Interlaken instance.

The flow_id parameter of the g5_api_ipts_mon_chnl_packet_cfg() API is the IPTS packet flow id value for each monitor channel. If flow_id = G5_MAX_INT then flow id checking will not be enabled in the IPTS monitor.

The fcs_gen_mode parameter of the g5_api_ipts_mon_chnl_packet_cfg() API defines the behavior of FCS in the generated packet and is defined by the g5_api_ipts_fcs_mode_t enumeration shown inTable 4 above.

The tag_location parameter of the g5_api_ipts_mon_chnl_packet_cfg() determines the offset where the IPTS packet tag is inserted in the packet and is defined by the g5_api_ipts_tag_frame_offset_t enumeration shown in Table 5 above. The default is G5_IPTS_TAG_FRAME_OFFSET_START.

section.title: g5_api_ipts_mon_chnl_seq_id_reset()
section.p: The g5_api_ipts_mon_chnl_seq_id_reset() API resets the monitor sequence id. To reset the sequence id users need to set the seq_id_reset = TRUE, and then call the g5_api_ipts_gen_cfg API to start the traffic on that channel. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chld_id parameter is the user defined channel ID for the provisioned Interlaken instance.

The seq_id_reset parameter of the g5_api_ipts_gen_chnl_seq_id_reset() API defines whether to reset generator sequence id. When set to TRUE the sequence id is reset . When set to FALSE the sequence id is not reset.
